lines.gurmukhi: jYsy drpin idib sUr snmuK rwKY pwvk pRgws hot ikrn cirqiR kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Darapani Dibi Soor Sanamoukh Raakhai , Paavak Pragaas Hot Kiran Charitri Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As a magnifying lens placed before the rays of the sun produces fire.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy myG brKq hI bsuMDrw ibrwjY ibibiD bnwspqI sPl suimqR kY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Maygh Barakhat Hee Basoundharaa Biraajai , Bibidhi Banaasapatee Sadhal Soumitr Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as earth looks good with rainfall and like a good friend produces fruits and flowers.

lines.gurmukhi: BYtq Bqwir nwir soBq isMgwir cwir pUrn AnMd suq auidiq bicq kY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaitat Bhataari Naari Sobhat Singaari Chaari , Pooran Anand Sout Uditi Bachit Kai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the conjugal union of a well adorned and embellished woman with her husband gives birth to a son and the wife is highly pleased.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur dris pris ibgsq isK pRwpq inDwn igAwn pwvn pivqR kY ]394]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Darasi Parasi Bigasat Sikha , Praapat Nidhaan Giaan Paavan Pavitr Kai ?394?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly an obedient disciple of the Guru feels pleased and blossoms at the sight of the True Guru. And by acquiring the treasure-house of divine knowledge and consecration of Naam Simran from his True Guru, he becomes a pious person.  (394)
